title: Mexican government puts grammatical 'errors' into textbooks
description: Mexico’s president has defended the insertion of what teachers have long considered grammatical errors into grade-school textbooks

title: At least 20 dead when bus hits bridge, burns in Saudi Arabia
description: State media in Sauid Arabia say at least 20 people were killed when a packed bus hit a bridge, overturned and burst into flames in the country’s southwest

title: Family of US couple kidnapped in Haiti plea for release
description: The family of a U.S. couple who has been kidnapped in Haiti is pleading for their release

title: What time is it? In Lebanon, no one is sure.
description: The Lebanese prime minister's attempt to help Muslims fasting for Ramadan by delaying the start of daylight saving time led to widespread derision and confusion.

title: US lawsuit seeks to protect habitat of endangered corals
description: An environmental organization is suing the U.S. government and accusing it of failing to protect 12 endangered coral species across the Caribbean and the Pacific Ocean that have been decimated by warming waters, pollution and overfishing

title: What to know about Israel’s protests and judicial overhaul
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s plan for judicial overhaul has plunged the country into crisis, setting off widespread strikes and protests.

title: Rebels kill at least 17 people in troubled eastern Congo
description: Local authorities in eastern Congo say that at least 17 people have been killed by rebels

title: Hungarian parliament approves Finland’s bid to join NATO
description: Hungary’s parliament has approved Finland’s bid to join NATO, ending months of delays and bringing the Nordic country one step closer to becoming a full member of the Western military alliance

title: EU Council chief vows support, ammunition for Ukraine
description: European Council President Charles Michel has pledged to continue supporting Ukraine against Russian aggression “for as long as necessary,” adding that EU leaders will “massively ramp up” ammunition production to send to the war-torn country

title: Scotland’s new leader, Hamza Yousaf, is pro-independence and Muslim
description: His ascension comes as both the British prime minister, Rishi Sunak, and the mayor of London, Sadiq Khan, are also children of immigrants from South Asia.

title: Turkey calls French envoy, protests hosting of Syria Kurds
description: Turkey’s state-run agency says Ankara has summoned France’s ambassador to condemn the French senate’s move to host representatives of Syrian Kurdish groups that Ankara considers to be terrorists

title: At least 16 death in landslide in Ecuador's Andean community
description: Emergency officials in Ecuador say at least 16 people died and 16 others were injured after a massive landslide

title: Meet the Israeli protesters resisting Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul
description: The protests rocking Israel have been extraordinary not just in size but in composition. The Post spoke with protesters about why they were in the streets.

title: Live updates: Israel plunges into crisis amid backlash over Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul plan
description: A general strike threatens to bring Israel to a standstill Monday amid growing fury at Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s judicial overhaul plan.

title: In Photos: Protests in Israel as rage mounts over courts overhaul
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu faced mounting pressure Monday to halt his government’s drive to remake Israel’s judicial system as the backlash against the plan engulfed the country and strikes threatened national paralysis.

title: UN-backed probe cites crimes against humanity in Libya
description: U.N.-backed human rights experts say there is evidence that crimes against humanity — including women being forced into sexual slavery — have been committed against Libyans and migrants in the North African country

title: UK pushes on with asylum law despite rights group opposition
description: The British government is pushing its contentious migration bill forward in Parliament, despite a call from Europe’s top human rights organization to block the legislation

title: How Netanyahu judicial plan sparked massive unrest in Israel
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s proposed judicial overhaul has unleashed the most intense social unrest in Israel in decades

title: Lebanon changes unpopular move to delay daylight saving time
description: Lebanon’s caretaker prime minister has reversed an unpopular decision made by his office to delay the start of daylight saving time by a month

title: Japanese student goes to graduation dressed like Zelenskyy
description: A Japanese student has showed up to graduation as Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy’s lookalike, wearing his signature olive-colored, snug-fit T-shirt and khaki trousers to show his support for Ukraine’s fight against Russia

title: Russian shelling of Ukraine city kills 2, wounds 29 people
description: Officials in Ukraine say two people were killed and 29 wounded when Russian forces shelled the Ukrainian city of Sloviansk, in the partially occupied eastern Donetsk region

title: Suicide bomber kills 6 people near foreign ministry in Kabul
description: A suicide bomber has struck near the foreign ministry in the Afghan capital, killing at least six people and wounding about a dozen

title: Poland: Foreigner held on suspicion of spying for Russia
description: Prosecutors in northern Poland say a foreign national suspected of spying for Russia will remain in custody for three months until an investigation is completed

title: Burkina Faso suspends France 24 for interview with jihadi
description: Burkina Faso’s military junta has suspended French broadcaster, France 24, for interviewing a top jihadi rebel

title: Greenland to stay in daylight saving time forever
description: Residents of Greenland have switched to daylight saving time and moved their clocks one hour forward for the very last time

title: More than 180 Rohingya refugees arrive on Indonesian beach
description: More than 180 disoriented Rohingya Muslims, some of whom need medical attention, have arrived in Indonesia’s northernmost province of Aceh

title: Prince Harry in court for privacy suit against tabloid
description: Prince Harry is in a London court as the lawyer for a group of British tabloids prepared to ask a judge to toss out lawsuits by the prince, Elton John and several other celebrities who allege phone tapping and other invasions of privacy

title: Prince Harry in court for privacy suit against tabloid
description: Prince Harry is in a London court as the lawyer for a group of British tabloids prepared to ask a judge to toss out lawsuits by the prince, Elton John and several other celebrities who allege phone tapping and other invasions of privacy

title: Kenya police on alert before expected opposition protests
description: Police in Kenya are on alert ahead of a second round of anti-government protests organized by the opposition that the government have declared illegal

title: Many rely on radio broadcasts in Zimbabwe and across Africa
description: In many Western countries, conventional radio has been overtaken by streaming, podcasts and on-demand content accessed via smartphones and computers

title: Israel faces airport closure, strikes as rage over courts overhaul mounts
description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is under more pressure from strikes and demonstrations after firing his defense minister for opposing the legislation.

title: In a first, former Taiwanese president Ma Ying-jeou travels to China
description: Ma’s trip comes the same week that Taiwan’s current president, Tsai Ing-wen, visits the United States, Belize and Guatemala, a trip expected to anger Beijing.

title: Ukraine live briefing: E.U. threatens sanctions on Belarus over Russian tactical nuclear weapons
description: E.U. foreign policy chief Josep Borrell threatened sanctions after Russian President Vladimir Putin announced that Belarus would host Russian tactical nuclear weapons.

title: Big Oil is selling off its polluting assets — with unintended consequences
description: Shell says its divestments in Nigeria help the company meet its green goals. But villagers and watchdogs say conditions have worsened after the sales.

title: Hong Kong sees first protest in three years — under strict controls
description: The protest, the first in Hong Kong since the coronavirus pandemic began, was limited to 100 people, who had to walk within cordon tape and wear numbered tags.

title: Israeli president urges Netanyahu to halt legal overhaul
description: Israel’s ceremonial president has urged Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to immediately halt a contentious overhaul of the judiciary

title: Taiwan’s freedoms vs. China’s money: The dilemma for those in the middle
description: Fears are growing that Beijing will use military force to take control of Taiwan. But on Kinmen, the Taiwanese island closest to China, it's money that talks.
